content.description: Fantastic climb that follows a seam up the first part, then traverses left under the overhang. Great holds all around.
content.location: Right in the middle, just to the right of Reggae Beanies (shares same anchors). This is the first route you will see when you arrive at the wall from the trail.

content.description: This is a short climb crux is in the middle going over the small bulge. 3 bolts to chains.
content.location:
Pull over at the

Knightland

turnoff. Hike up to

Hidden Wall

,

Rotten Carcass

is on the wall just right of

Northface Massacre

.

content.description: Very fun, 3 tiered roof climb. Start to the left of The Shoot, going straight at the multi-layered roof. There are some very fun moves to get you over the roof, and once on top, it shares anchors with The Shoot.
content.location: To the left of The Shoot, right of Queer Old Dean

content.description:
Rain Delay

is a really fun long 5.7 route it has 11 bolts to chains in about 90 ft. The crux is at the top just before the last bolt, you can go right for easier climbing if needed.

Rain Delay

is new as of 2012 so please be careful there is still some loose rock.
content.location:
Rain Delay

is about 25 ft left of the main area of

Hidden Wall

, and 10 ft right of

The Oaks

. It is located on the black face to the left as you are hiking up to

Knightland

.

content.description: The crux is a little off the ground and then the terrain easy up quite a bit.
Climb the corner to the walk off
content.protection: "Small Nuts and Pins Provide protection".  Walk off on the top.
content.location: ~10 feet to the left of Rain Delay

content.description: Climb the steep technical face (5.10a) right under the 4 ft roof. Pull the roof using holds on the right and the crack to a good ledge on the face above. Continue on easy climbing to the chains.
content.location:
Hike up to

Knightland

take the second cairn on the left to

Hidden Wall

.

Northface Massacre

is on the far right end of

Hidden Wall

, right of

The Pirate

.

content.description:
This gem of a climb is the next to the right of

The Shoot

, and climbs up and over the roof. The crux is getting over the roof, but if you can get your balance enough to reach over, there are two fantastic jugs, one for each hand, to get you over the roof.
content.location:
To the right of

The Shoot

, just up the trail 20 feet.
